alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Mainland Hyde; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hyde, east central Beaufort, southern Tyrrell and northeastern Pamlico Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sladesville, or 29 miles east of River Road, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sladesville, Scranton, Fairfield, Swindell Fork, Rose Bay and Swan Quarter Ferry Terminal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
